newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks seen down in lacklustre trading.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks seen down in lacklustre trading.

text.p: Pakistani stocks are likely to ease further on Friday because of a lack of interest by investors before the 1997/98 (July-June) budget is handed down, dealers said.
The budget is due on June 14.
"Sentiment is weak as investors' are in a wait-and-see mood," dealer Rony Byramjee said. "The index is likely to edge down as there is no support amid low trading volume."
On Thursday, the Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index fell 7.84 points, or 0.50 percent, to end at 1,547.67. Losers outnumbered advancers by 180 to 92.
